title: Is using “?” allowed in first person writing? - Quora

response.answer_text: It’s allowed! It can be used in several circumstances. The obvious one being diologue. Another is when addressing the reader. Another is when the narrator asks a question in their head. There are probably more, but that’s what I can think of right now. Hope this helps!!
I will assume that you are asking about using a quotation mark at the end of a question. Yes. It is allowed. Does “?” have some other meaning that the rest of us do not know?
Punctuation has nothing to do with the point of view/narration, so yes. If you are asking if you can use questions, you should avoid them unless they are rare, well-placed rhetorical questions.
